Core Models¶

The following classes form the core lavaFlow functionality, they are used by all scheduling environments, and contain all the data required for the core reports.

lavaFlow.models.ImportKey¶

class lavaFlow.models.ImportKey(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Any client that attempts to import data must present a valid key. Keys in general should be managed through the admin control panel.:

>>> from lavaFlow.models import ImportKey
>>> try:
>>>     key=ImportKey.objects.get(client_key="key_to_check")
>>>     # Key is valid.
>>> except ObjectDoesNotExist as e:
>>>     # Key is invalid.
client_key¶

The Client Key, used by each uploader to authenticate. This is very rudimentary.

comment¶

Optional comment/description field, free form, example might include which servers/clusters are using this key. Not used in any way for authentication.

__str__()[source]¶

Returns a str containing the client key.

Returns:str(client_key)
__unicode__()[source]¶

Returns the unicode represenation of the client_key

Returns:unicode(client_key)

lavaFlow.models.Cluster¶

class lavaFlow.models.Cluster(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Almost every bit of data stored in lavaFlow can be traced back to a cluster, clusters represent the physical compute clusters that jobs are executed on. There could be just one, for a simple departmental cluster, or many for an entire organization with both regional and centralized compute services. Cluster objects are generally created automatically by the agents monitoring the cluster. Extended information is generally added by the end user via the admin interface.:

>>> from lavaFlow.models import Cluster
>>> (cluster, created) = Cluster.objects.get_or_create(name="openlava")
>>> cluster.name

u’openlava’ >>> cluster.total_attempts() 9000 >>> cluster.first_task() <Attempt: Attempt object> >>> cluster.last_task() <Attempt: Attempt object> >>> cluster.average_pend_time_timedelta() datetime.timedelta(0, 12001, 831000) >>> cluster.average_pend_time() 12001.831

name¶

This is the name of the cluster, generally this is whatever the scheduler thinks its name is, however it can be overridden manually by the cluster administator.

__str__()[source]¶

Returns a str containing the name of the cluster.

Returns:str(name)
__unicode__()[source]¶

Returns a unicode str containing the name of the cluster.

Returns:unicode(self.__str__())
average_pend_time()[source]¶

Calculates the average pend time in seconds for all jobs that executed on the cluster.

Returns:Number of seconds on average that jobs pend for on this cluster.
average_pend_time_percent()[source]¶

Gets the average pend time of jobs on the cluster as a percent of their overall wall clock time.

Returns:Average Pend Time as a percent
average_pend_time_timedelta()[source]¶

Timedelta object of the number of seconds that jobs pend for

Returns:Average pend time as timedelta.
average_wall_time()[source]¶

Calculates the average wall clock time in seconds for all jobs that executed on the cluster.

Returns:Number of seconds on average that jobs take from submission to completion.
average_wall_time_timedelta()[source]¶

Timedelta object of the number of seconds of the average wall clock time.

Returns:Average wall clock time as timedelta.
first_task()[source]¶

Gets the first task that was executed on the cluster. If no tasks were executed on the cluster, returns None.

Returns:Attempt object of the first attempt executed.
get_absolute_url(*moreargs, **morekwargs)[source]¶

The absolute URL to the cluster view.

Returns:URL of the cluster view page for this instance.
last_failed_task()[source]¶

Gets the last task that exited with a non-successful exit state on the cluster. If no tasks have been executed on the cluster, or none of the tasks have exited witha failure, returns None

Returns:Attempt object of the last attempt that failed, returns None of no failed attempts.
last_task()[source]¶

Gets the last task that ended on the cluster, regardless of exit status. If no tasks have been executed on the cluster, returns None

Returns:Attempt object of the last attempt ended, returns None of no attempts.
total_attempts()[source]¶

Returns an total number of tasks that have been executed on this cluster since time began.

Returns:Integer containing total number of tasks
total_jobs()[source]¶

Returns an total number of jobs that have been submitted to this cluster since time began.

Returns:Integer containing total number of jobs
total_tasks()[source]¶

Returns an total number of tasks that have been submitted to this cluster since time began.

Returns:Integer containing total number of tasks

lavaFlow.models.ClusterLog¶

class lavaFlow.models.ClusterLog(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

ClusterLog objects are log entries that relate to the cluster as a whole. These can be created by tools, or through the admin interface by an administator.

cluster¶

Foreign key to the Cluster that the log is part of

time¶

Time of the log entry, in seconds since Epoch

message¶

The message, a text field that can contain freeform text.

class lavaFlow.models.Job(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Job(id, cluster_id, job_id, user_id, submit_host_id, submit_time, submit_hour_of_day, submit_day_of_week, submit_day_of_month, submit_week_of_year, submit_month)

class lavaFlow.models.JobLog(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

JobLog(id, cluster_id, time, message, clusterlog_ptr_id, job_id)

class lavaFlow.models.Task(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Task(id, cluster_id, job_id, user_id, task_id, submit_time, submit_hour_of_day, submit_day_of_week, submit_day_of_month, submit_week_of_year, submit_month)

class lavaFlow.models.Attempt(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Each time a task is started on one or more compute nodes, it is called an attempt. Tasks that fail and are restarted may have multiple attempts.

cluster¶

Cluster object that this attempt is part of.

job¶

Job object that this attempt is part of.

task¶

Task object that this attempt is part of.

user¶

User object that this attempt belongs to

num_processors¶

Number of processors this attempt was dispatched to

projects¶

QuerySet containing all Project objects that this attempt is part of. May be part of multiple projects where supported by the scheduling environment.

execution_hosts¶

QuerySet containing all Host objects that where assigned to this attempt. Not all scheduling systems are able to report which hosts were used for a task. In that case only the primary host will be given.

submit_time¶

The time in seconds since epoch UTC that the task was submitted to the cluster

start_time¶

The time in seconds since epoch UTC that the task was executed

end_time¶

The time in seconds since epoch UTC that the task ended

cpu_time¶

The cpu time in seconds for the job.

wall_time¶

The wall clock time in seconds for the job.

pend_time¶

The number of seconds the job was pending

queue¶

The Queue object the job was in

status¶

The Exit Status of the job

command¶

The command executed by the job

class lavaFlow.models.Queue(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Queue(id, cluster_id, name)

class lavaFlow.models.Project(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Projects are used to store the project name that jobs were submitted to, jobs of course can be submitted to multiple projects, and this is also supported. Projects are unique globally.

name¶

This is the name of the project, as reported by the scheduler.

__str__()[source]¶

Returns a str containing the name of the project.

Returns:str(name)
__unicode__()[source]¶

Returns a unicode str containing the name of the project.

Returns:unicode(self.__str__())
average_pend_time()[source]¶

Calculates the average pend time in seconds for all jobs that were submitted under this project.

Returns:Number of seconds on average that jobs pend for this project.
average_pend_time_percent()[source]¶

Gets the average pend time of jobs submitted under this project as a percent of their overall wall clock time.

Returns:Average Pend Time as a percent
average_pend_time_timedelta()[source]¶

Timedelta object of the number of seconds that jobs pend for

Returns:Average pend time as timedelta.
average_wall_time()[source]¶

Calculates the average wall clock time in seconds for all jobs that were submitted under this project.

Returns:Number of seconds on average that jobs take from submission to completion.
average_wall_time_timedelta()[source]¶

Timedelta object of the number of seconds of the average wall clock time.

Returns:Average wall clock time as timedelta.
first_task()[source]¶

Gets the first task that was executed under this project. If no tasks were executed, returns None.

Returns:Attempt object of the first attempt executed.
get_absolute_url(*moreargs, **morekwargs)[source]¶

The absolute URL to the project view.

Returns:URL of the project view page for this instance.
last_failed_task()[source]¶

Gets the last task that exited with a non-successful exit state under this project. If no tasks have been executed under this project, or none of the tasks have exited with a failure, returns None.

Returns:Attempt object of the last attempt that failed, returns None of no failed attempts.
last_task()[source]¶

Gets the last task under this project that ended, regardless of exit status. If no tasks have been executed on the under this project, returns None

Returns:Attempt object of the last attempt ended, returns None of no attempts.
total_attempts()[source]¶

Returns an total number of tasks that have been executed under this project since time began.

Returns:Integer containing total number of tasks
total_jobs()[source]¶

Returns an total number of jobs that have been submitted to this project since time began.

Returns:Integer containing total number of jobs
total_tasks()[source]¶

Returns an total number of tasks that have been submitted to this project since time began.

Returns:Integer containing total number of tasks
class lavaFlow.models.Host(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Hosts represent actual hosts, these may be any arbitrary host, but generally are hosts that are either execution hosts or submission hosts.

name¶

This is the name of the host. It is generally not the fully qualified domain name, but simply the local hostname.

class lavaFlow.models.HostLog(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

HostLog(id, cluster_id, time, message, clusterlog_ptr_id, host_id)

class lavaFlow.models.QueueLog(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

QueueLog(id, cluster_id, time, message, clusterlog_ptr_id, queue_id)

class lavaFlow.models.User(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

User(id, name)

class lavaFlow.models.UserLog(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

UserLog(id, cluster_id, time, message, clusterlog_ptr_id, user_id)

class lavaFlow.models.AttemptResourceUsage(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Resource usage measures for the attempt, taken from the getrusage() system call. Not all schedulers support this operation, and where not supported, this will not be created.

attempt¶

The attempt object that this instance refers to.

user_time¶

This is the total amount of time spent executing in user mode, in seconds.

system_time¶

This is the total amount of time spent executing in kernel mode, in seconds.

max_rss¶

This is the maximum resident set size used (in kilobytes).

integral_shared_text¶

Integral shared text size.

integral_shared_memory¶

Integral shared memory size.

integral_unshared_data¶

Integral unshared data.

integral_unshared_stack¶

Integral unshared stack.

page_reclaims¶

The number of page faults serviced without any I/O activity; Here I/O activity is avoided by “reclaiming” a page frame from the list of pages awaiting reallocation.

page_faults¶

The number of page faults serviced that required I/O activity.

swaps¶

Swap Operations.

input_block_ops¶

The number of times the filesystem had to perform input.

output_block_ops¶

The number of times the filesystem had to perform output.

character_io_ops¶

# of characters read/written.

messages_sent¶

Messages sent.

messages_received¶

Messages received.

num_signals¶

Signals received.

voluntary_context_switches¶

The number of times a context switch resulted due to a process voluntarily giving up the processor before its time slice was completed (usually to await availability of a resource).

involuntary_context_switches¶

The number of times a context switch resulted due to a higher priority process becoming runnable or because the current process exceeded its time slice.

exact_user_time¶

Exact user time used.
